intro: Cracca semiglabra, commonly known as the smooth cracca, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are typically smooth and lance-shaped, contributing to its common name. Cracca semiglabra is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
